text: One of my biggest problems is refactoring a module or adding / removing fields in the module -- then having to reload all of the content on the page level. Currently you need to add another instance of the module, copy and paste your content, then remove the old iteration of the module on the page level. Let's see if we can get some upvotes behind this idea so we can have a "reset" button on the page level that brings the new module in and keeps the content in place. A HubSpot support person has setup the current idea for us to upvote. He will be meeting with the product team later this week. Let's get some steam behind this so we can streamline updating modules  <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Option-to-Reset-Module-at-Page-Level/idi-p/252089#M29361>
FYI, I had to replace the module with a new instance
But now im having another issue.

Hi Community,

When editing an email in HS in the design manager you can add custom class and then make design change changes "grey-rounded-box" Anyone has any insight on the CSS needed to add the grey boxes similar to the design here?
Sorry for the late reply. We were looking at it last Friday, and found there is bug in our code. We are working on a fix.
classes don't generally work well in all email platform -- you would want to give that element a `style="background-color: grey; border-radius: 5px;"`
